comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I used a script to create webloc files on OS X. The files were xml, identical to the XML contents of a webloc file that is created when you drag a url from the path bar to the desktop. 


Actual results:

FF opened the XML with the "This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below." header. It did not go to the target URL from the webloc file


Expected results:

FF should have gone to the url given in the xml. However FF does not use the xml, it uses data from the resource fork, which is a less inuitive, less hackable way of doing things, and it is restricted to Mac systems. FF should be able to open .webloc files without any resource fork. This would allow for example storing a user's bookmarks as webloc files for spotlight searching.
